description: Commentary The federal government’s immigration policy, including increasing the number of newcomers to 500,000 per year, has elicited much criticism of late. The effect so many newcomers have had on a tight housing and rental market has been noted repeatedly. But one of the primary concerns about Canada’s refugee and citizenship system relates to national […]
title: Immigration Without Proper Screening Is Opening the Door to Security Threats in Canada

description: The Bloc Québécois is ready to wheel and deal with Prime Minister Justin Trudeau’s government in exchange for support during confidence votes now that the Liberal government’s confidence and supply agreement with the NDP has ended. That support won’t come cheap, the Quebec-based Bloc said, and the sovereigntist party led by Yves-François Blanchet has already […]
title: Bloc Québécois Ready to Extract Gains for Quebec in Exchange for Supporting Liberals

description: A Quebec man has been sentenced to nine months in jail for importing counterfeit toonies from China. Jean-François Généreux faced multiple charges, including giving false information in a customs declaration and buying, possessing, and bringing into Canada over 26,000 counterfeit $2 coins made in China, says a Nov. 6, 2023, news release from the Canada […]
title: Quebec Man Sentenced to Prison for Importing Over 26,000 Fake $2 Coins From China

description: Prime Minister Justin Trudeau will face a fretful and strained caucus in British Columbia Monday, with MPs looking for him to finally reveal his plan to address the political purgatory the party has endured for months. Several Liberal MPs privately and publicly demanded they meet as a team after the devastating byelection loss of a […]
title: Trudeau to Face Fretful Caucus Ahead of Return to the House

description: Beijing said it 'will not continue to process cases at any stage,' other than those covered by a narrow exception.
title: CCP Bans Foreign Adoptions of Chinese Children

description: Spain’s government said the decision to abandon Venezuela was González's alone and he departed on a plane sent by the country's air force.
title: Venezuelan Opposition Presidential Candidate Leaves Country for Asylum in Spain

description: Preparation have begun as Australia enters migration season.
title: Australia Braces for Deadly Bird Flu Outbreak

description: HANOI, Vietnam—At least 14 people have died and 176 others injured in Vietnam after Typhoon Yagi slammed the country’s north, state media said on Sept. 8, as officials warned of heavy downpours despite its waning power. Described by Vietnamese officials as one of the most powerful typhoons to hit the region over the last decade, […]
title: Typhoon Yagi Kills at Least 14, Injures 176 in Vietnam

description: HANOI, Vietnam—Vietnamese authorities say Typhoon Yagi has killed at least four people and injured 78 others after making landfall Saturday afternoon in the north of the country. Yagi, described by Vietnamese meteorological officials as “one of the most powerful typhoons in the region over the past decade,” made its way to the Southeast Asian country […]
title: Typhoon Yagi Leaves at Least 4 Dead and Scores Injured in Vietnam

description: HANOI, Vietnam—Vietnamese authorities say Typhoon Yagi has killed at least four people and injured 78 others after making landfall Saturday afternoon in the north of the country. Yagi, described by Vietnamese meteorological officials as “one of the most powerful typhoons in the region over the past decade,” made its way to the Southeast Asian country […]
title: Vietnamese Authorities Say Typhoon Yagi Has Killed at Least 4 and Injured 78 Others After Making Landfall

description: NAIROBI, Kenya—The number of children who were burned to death in a school dormitory in central Kenya has risen to 21, the government spokesperson said Saturday. Officials began removing the bodies of the children as they tried to account for dozens of boys who were still missing. Journalists were moved to wait outside the Hillside […]
title: 21 Children Are Now Known to Have Died in Kenya School Fire

description: ABIDJAN, Ivory Coast—A tanker truck crashed into a bus in northern Ivory Coast, killing 13 people and injuring 44, the Transportation Ministry and local media said Saturday. The bus and the truck crashed Friday night on the highway between Bouake and Korhogo, two large cities in the country’s north. The road’s width had been narrowed […]
title: Tanker Truck Crashes Into Bus in Ivory Coast Killing 13 and Injuring 44

description: ANKARA, Turkey—A Vistara airline flight en route to Germany from India made a forced landing in Turkey on Friday following a bomb threat, Turkish officials said. Flight VTI027 from Mumbai to Frankfurt, with 234 passengers and 13 crew members on board, landed at the airport in Erzurum, in eastern Turkey, and the passengers were safely […]
title: Bomb Threat Forces Vistara Airline Plane En Route to Frankfurt to Land in Turkey

description: Advanced voting kicked off on Friday in Montreal’s LaSalle-Émard-Verdun riding, and party leaders are helping get out the vote as the federal byelection on Sept. 16. draws nearer. Polls show a three-way battle emerging between the Liberal Party of Canada, the Bloc Québécois and the New Democratic Party and although LaSalle-Émard-Verdun is considered a Liberal […]
title: Montreal Byelection Candidates Go Door-to-Door on Early Voting Day

description: Independent Federal Senator David Pocock has renewed calls to ban the use of generative artificial intelligence in the next federal election campaign. Senator Pocock has shared two fake AI videos to social media depicting Prime Minister Anthony Albanese and Opposition leader Peter Dutton agreeing to ban all forms of gambling advertising, to show just how […]
title: Senator Renews Calls for AI Ban in Election Campaigning

description: The prime minister defended the RBA's monetary policy, adding the government has many schemes assisting households with cost of living.
title: Government Overspending on Unprofitable Sectors Could Destroy Australia’s Wealth: Expert Warns

description: CIA Director Bill Burns and MI6 Director Richard Moore said the CCP is 'the principal intelligence and geopolitical challenge of the 21st century.'
title: CIA, MI6 Directors Tout Partnership to Counter Russia and China

description: Artificial intelligence (AI) technology has been developing rapidly and has the potential to change the job market, according to research from Statistics Canada. While some jobs can benefit from the technology, others could be taken over by it. The report, Experimental Estimates of Potential Artificial Intelligence Occupational Exposure in Canada, looked at what type of […]
title: Which Jobs Are More Resistant to Being Replaced by AI?

description: Emissions from coal and gas could grow by 1.7 billion tonnes by 2050 if their use is extended another 15 years, according to analysis from the federal government. The government evaluated data from the 2024 Integrated System Plan by the Australian Energy Market Operator (AEMO), which provides a road map for Australia’s energy transition for […]
title: Emissions Blowout Flagged If Coal, Gas Extended: Government
